content.question: The momentum <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for each of two objects, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, is given by the graph during the same time interval. Which object, if either, has a greater net force exerted on it and which statement justifies this?

choices.label: Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> because its momentum is greater in magnitude than Object <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>’s momentum at all times shown.

Object <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> because the area under the curve during the entire interval of motion is greater than the area under the curve for Object <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>.
Both objects have the same net force because the objects have the same change in velocity during the time interval.
Both objects have the same net force because the slope of each object’s momentum versus time graph is the same.

content.answer: Both objects have the same net force because the slope of each object’s momentum versus time graph is the same.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
